intro: Epacris, commonly known as the heath or fairy candles, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their narrow, evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Epacris species are often found in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. They are part of the plant family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and unique floral structures.
